page.title: 09PARISH OF TIBBERMORE (2)
page.content: The cattle courts are very modern and are half-brick construction finished with walls of slatted plastic sheet, in order to allow maximum ventilation. The cattle inside are automatically fed with bruised barley and are given a plentiful supply of straw. The courts are ventilated by huge fans driven by electricity which draw out the air and keep it fresh and cool. The farm is about five hundred and fifty acres in size, two hundred anf fifty to three hundred acres of cereals are grown. There are fifty to sixty acres of grazing pasture and about two hundred acres which cover rough grazing, woodland, farm roads, a loch of about ten acres and scrub land.
